markdownRemark.html:
Describing a SARIMA Model

  • A SARIMA model is an ARIMA model that accounts for seasonality
  • Here, seasonality just refers to a repeating pattern within a year (i.e. can't be a two-year pattern)

  • A SARIMA model is defined as the following:

    ARIMA(p,d,q)(P,D,Q)mARIMA(p,d,q)(P,D,Q)mARIMA(p,d,q)(P,D,Q)m
    • Where ppp refers to the order of the autoregressive portion of the ARIMA model
    • Where ddd refers to the order of the integrated portion of the ARIMA model (i.e. how many times we take a difference to get our model to be stationary)
    • Where qqq refers to the order of the moving average portion of the ARIMA model
    • Where mmm refers to the seasonal factor (i.e. the number of distinct periods within a year that make up a single seasonal pattern that is repeated over time)
    • Where PPP refers to the order of the autoregressive portion of the ARIMA model, with an additional seasonal component
    • Where DDD refers to the order of the integrated porition of the ARIMA model, with an additional seasonal component
    • Where QQQ refers to the order of the order of the moving average porition of the ARIMA model, with an additional seasonal component
  • A SARIMA model can also be written as an ARIMA model:
ARIMA(p,d,q)1(P,D,Q)mARIMA(p,d,q)_{1}(P,D,Q)mARIMA(p,d,q)1â€‹(P,D,Q)m
  • This is because we're technically backshifting parameters p,d,p, d,p,d, and qqq by 111 (i.e. st+1âˆ’sts_{t+1} - s_{t}st+1â€‹âˆ’stâ€‹)

Example of SARIMA Model

  • Let's say we define the following SARIMA model:
ARIMA(1,0,0)(0,1,1)4ARIMA(1,0,0)(0,1,1)_{4}ARIMA(1,0,0)(0,1,1)4â€‹

  • The ppp parameter with a value equal to 111 can be translated to the following:

    (1âˆ’Ï•1B1)yt(1-\phi_{1}B^{1})y_{t}(1âˆ’Ï•1â€‹B1)ytâ€‹
    • Where B1ytB^{1}y_{t}B1ytâ€‹ is our lag operator representing ytâˆ’1y_{t-1}ytâˆ’1â€‹
    • Where Ï•1\phi_{1}Ï•1â€‹ is the slope of our variable ytâˆ’1y_{t-1}ytâˆ’1â€‹
    • Therefore, (1âˆ’Ï•1B1)yt(1-\phi_{1}B^{1})y_{t}(1âˆ’Ï•1â€‹B1)ytâ€‹ is just shorthand for ytâˆ’Ï•1ytâˆ’1y_{t}-\phi_{1}y_{t-1}ytâ€‹âˆ’Ï•1â€‹ytâˆ’1â€‹

  • The DDD parameter with a value equal to 111 can be translated to the following:

    (1âˆ’B4)yt(1-B^{4})y_{t}(1âˆ’B4)ytâ€‹
    • Where B4ytB^{4}y_{t}B4ytâ€‹ is our lag operator representing ytâˆ’4y_{t-4}ytâˆ’4â€‹
    • Therefore, (1âˆ’B4)yt(1-B^{4})y_{t}(1âˆ’B4)ytâ€‹ is just shorthand for z=ytâˆ’ytâˆ’4z = y_{t}-y_{t-4}z=ytâ€‹âˆ’ytâˆ’4â€‹

  • The QQQ parameter with a value equal to 111 can be translated to the following:

    (1+Î¸1B4)Ïµt(1+\theta_{1}B^{4})\epsilon_{t}(1+Î¸1â€‹B4)Ïµtâ€‹

    • Where B4ÏµtB^{4}\epsilon_{t}B4Ïµtâ€‹ is our lag operator representing Ïµtâˆ’4\epsilon_{t-4}Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹

      • Where Ïµtâˆ’4\epsilon_{t-4}Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹ is the error of the fourth previous predicted value and what we observed
      • Where Î¸1\theta_{1}Î¸1â€‹ represents the percentage of the error Ïµtâˆ’4\epsilon_{t-4}Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹ we should include in our model
      • Therefore, (1âˆ’Î¸1B4)Ïµt(1-\theta_{1}B^{4})\epsilon_{t}(1âˆ’Î¸1â€‹B4)Ïµtâ€‹ is just shorthand for Ïµt+Î¸1Ïµtâˆ’4\epsilon_{t}+\theta_{1}\epsilon_{t-4}Ïµtâ€‹+Î¸1â€‹Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹
  • We can continue to simplify our SARIMA model to the following formulas:
(1âˆ’Ï•1B1)(1âˆ’B4)yt=(1+Î¸1B4)Ïµt(1-\phi_{1}B^{1})(1-B^{4})y_{t} = (1+\theta_{1}B^{4})\epsilon_{t}(1âˆ’Ï•1â€‹B1)(1âˆ’B4)ytâ€‹=(1+Î¸1â€‹B4)Ïµtâ€‹ (1âˆ’Ï•1B1âˆ’B4+Ï•1B5)yt=Ïµt+Î¸1Ïµtâˆ’4(1-\phi_{1}B^{1}-B^{4}+\phi_{1}B^{5})y_{t} = \epsilon_{t}+\theta_{1}\epsilon_{t-4}(1âˆ’Ï•1â€‹B1âˆ’B4+Ï•1â€‹B5)ytâ€‹=Ïµtâ€‹+Î¸1â€‹Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹ ytâˆ’Ï•1ytâˆ’1âˆ’ytâˆ’4+Ï•1ytâˆ’5=Ïµt+Î¸1Ïµtâˆ’4y_{t} - \phi_{1}y_{t-1} - y_{t-4} + \phi_{1}y_{t-5} = \epsilon_{t} + \theta_{1}\epsilon_{t-4}ytâ€‹âˆ’Ï•1â€‹ytâˆ’1â€‹âˆ’ytâˆ’4â€‹+Ï•1â€‹ytâˆ’5â€‹=Ïµtâ€‹+Î¸1â€‹Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹ ytâˆ’ytâˆ’4=Ï•1ytâˆ’1âˆ’Ï•1ytâˆ’5+Î¸1Ïµtâˆ’4+Ïµty_{t} - y_{t-4} = \phi_{1}y_{t-1} - \phi_{1}y_{t-5} + \theta_{1}\epsilon_{t-4} + \epsilon_{t}ytâ€‹âˆ’ytâˆ’4â€‹=Ï•1â€‹ytâˆ’1â€‹âˆ’Ï•1â€‹ytâˆ’5â€‹+Î¸1â€‹Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹+Ïµtâ€‹ zt=Ï•1ztâˆ’1+Î¸1Ïµtâˆ’4+Ïµtz_{t} = \phi_{1}z_{t-1} + \theta_{1}\epsilon_{t-4} + \epsilon_{t}ztâ€‹=Ï•1â€‹ztâˆ’1â€‹+Î¸1â€‹Ïµtâˆ’4â€‹+Ïµtâ€‹
  • Since z=ytâˆ’ytâˆ’4z = y_{t}-y_{t-4}z=ytâ€‹âˆ’ytâˆ’4â€‹ is based on parameter DDD
  • Now, we've transformed our ARIMA model to account for seasonality by taking differences ytâˆ’ytâˆ’4y_{t} - y_{t-4}ytâ€‹âˆ’ytâˆ’4â€‹, which will lead to a more stationary model
